title: 107_hr1492
content: SECTION 1. TREATMENT OF EXPORT LEASES. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes leasing tangible property to foreign persons or entities. The definition of tangible property excludes nonresidential real property. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes leasing tangible property to foreign persons or entities, excluding nonresidential real property. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 pertains to the taxation of income derived by a shareholder from a controlled foreign corporation. The exclusion or exemption does not apply to determine gross income but applies to determine the portion subject to tax. The term 'foreign person or entity' is defined for these purposes. The term 'foreign person or entity' includes foreign governments, international organizations, agencies, and individuals who are not US persons. It excludes foreign partnerships and other pass-thru entities. Rules similar to subsection (h) apply to property leased to partnerships or tiered entities. The text discusses amendments to the tax code regarding foreign partnerships and pass-thru entities. It clarifies that partners of foreign partnerships are presumed to be non-US persons unless proven otherwise. Additionally, there are conforming amendments related to specific clauses in the tax code. The tax code is amended by changing various subparagraphs and sections, such as striking and inserting different paragraphs and subsections. The tax code is amended by changing various subparagraphs and sections, such as striking and inserting different paragraphs and subsections. The amendments made by this section apply to leases entered into after the date of the enactment of this Act.
